draw_sprite_stretched: This function simply takes a sprite resource and stretches it over the given width and height so that it occupies the area. As with draw_sprite() you can specify a sprite and a sub-image for drawing, then the x / y position in the room for the sprite to be drawn at and finally a width and a height (which must be pixel values). The image below illustrates how this function works:
NOTE: When drawing with this function, the sprite x offset and y offset are ignored and the sprite will be drawn with the top left corner at the specified x / y position in the room.
draw_sprite_stretched(sprite, subimg, x, y, w, h);
The index of the sprite to draw.
The subimg (frame) of the sprite to draw (image_index or -1 correlate to the current frame of animation in the object).
The x coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The y coordinate of where to draw the sprite.
The width of the area the stretched sprite will occupy.
The height of the area the stretched sprite will occupy.
{ANY_CODE} draw_sprite_stretched(sprite_index, image_index, x, y, sprite_width / 2, sprite_height / 2);

This will draw the instances assigned sprite and its sub-image with the left corner at the instance x /y position. Its width is set to the same as the sprite, and the height is the sprite height divided by two.
